alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dickinson and southern Marquette Counties through 345 PM EDT/245 PM CDT/... At 322 PM EDT/222 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Witch Lake, or 20 miles southwest of Ishpeming, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Dickinson and southern Marquette Counties, including the following locations... Northland, Anderson Lake, Silver Lake near Channing, Big Bass Lake and Arnold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT/800 PM CDT/ for north central Upper and south central Upper Michigan.
